metadata.title: Access from the Network - Administrators
metadata.description: Administrators may access this computer from the network. NOTE: This can break IPSec see Microsoft Knowledge Base article 823659 for further guidance

criterion.comment: Access This Computer From The Network - Administrators
Access This Computer From The Network - No one other than Administrators

metadata.title: Act as Part of the Operating System - None
metadata.description: No one has the right to act as part of the operating system

criterion.comment: No one has the right to act as part of the operating system

metadata.title: Adjust Memory Quotas - Administrators, LOCAL SERVICE, NETWORK SERVICE
metadata.description: Administrators, LOCAL SERVICE, NETWORK SERVICE may adjust memory quotas for a process

criterion.comment: Administrators may adjust memory quotas for a process
LOCAL SERVICE may adjust memory quotas for a process
NETWORK SERVICE may adjust memory quotas for a process
No one but Administrators, LOCAL SERVICE, and NETWORK SERVICE may adjust memory quotas for a process

metadata.title: Log On Locally - Administrators, Users
metadata.description: Administrators and Users are allowed to log on locally

criterion.comment: Administrators are allowed to log on locally
Users are allowed to log on locally
No one but Administrators and Users are allowed to log on locally

metadata.title: Logon Through Terminal Services - Administrators, Remote Desktop Users
metadata.description: Administrators, Remote Desktop Users are allowed to logon through Terminal Services

criterion.comment: Administrators are allowed to Logon Through Terminal Services
Remote Desktop Users are allowed to Logon Through Terminal Services
No one but Administrators and Remote Desktop Users are allowed to Logon Through Terminal Services

metadata.description: Administrators are allowed to back up files and directories

metadata.title: Registry Policy Processing
metadata.description: Registry Policy Processing

criterion.comment: The registry key HKLM\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Group Policy\{35378EAC-683F-11D2-A89A-00C04FBBCFA2} does not exist.
The registry key HKLM\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Group Policy\{35378EAC-683F-11D2-A89A-00C04FBBCFA2}!NoBackgroundPolicy has a value of 0
The registry key HKLM\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Group Policy\{35378EAC-683F-11D2-A89A-00C04FBBCFA2}!NoGPOListChanges has a value of 1.
The registry key HKLM\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Group Policy\{35378EAC-683F-11D2-A89A-00C04FBBCFA2}!NoBackgroundPolicy has a value of 1
The registry key HKLM\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Group Policy\{35378EAC-683F-11D2-A89A-00C04FBBCFA2}!NoGPOListChanges has a value of 1.
The registry key HKLM\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Group Policy\{35378EAC-683F-11D2-A89A-00C04FBBCFA2}!NoBackgroundPolicy has a value of 0
The registry key HKLM\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Group Policy\{35378EAC-683F-11D2-A89A-00C04FBBCFA2}!NoGPOListChanges has a value of 0.
The registry key HKLM\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Group Policy\{35378EAC-683F-11D2-A89A-00C04FBBCFA2}!NoBackgroundPolicy has a value of 1
The registry key HKLM\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Group Policy\{35378EAC-683F-11D2-A89A-00C04FBBCFA2}!NoGPOListChanges has a value of 0.

metadata.title: Maximum Application Log Size
metadata.description: This definition tests the the maximum allowed size of the application log is at least as big as the supplied value.

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\EventLog\Application!MaxSize has type REG_DWORD and a value greater than or equal to the defined number of KB

metadata.title: Maximum Security Log Size
metadata.description: This definition tests the the maximum allowed size of the security log is at least as big as the supplied value.

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\EventLog\Security!MaxSize has type REG_DWORD and a value greater than or equal to the defined number of KB

metadata.title: Maximum Setup Log Size
metadata.description: This definition tests the the maximum allowed size of the setup log is at least as big as the supplied value.

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\EventLog\Setup!MaxSize has type REG_DWORD and a value greater than or equal to the defined number of KB

metadata.title: Maximum System Log Size
metadata.description: This definition tests the the maximum allowed size of the system log is at least as big as the supplied value.

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\EventLog\System!MaxSize has type REG_DWORD and a value greater than or equal to the defined number of KB

metadata.title: Turn Off Downloading of Game Information
metadata.description: Turn Off Downloading of Game Information

metadata.title: Prevent IIS Installation
metadata.description: This blocks even local Administrators from adding local web services to the Vista client

metadata.title: Disable remote Desktop Sharing
metadata.description: Disable remote Desktop Sharing

metadata.title: Turn off Untrusted Content
metadata.description: Specifies whether untrusted content is rendered. By default, the Help viewer renders untrusted assistance content pages with the exception of active links. Active links, such as ShellExecute and Guided Help, are rendered as text and are not clickable.

metadata.title: Allow indexing of encrypted files
metadata.description: Allow indexing of encrypted files

metadata.title: Prevent indexing uncached Exchange folders
metadata.description: Prevent indexing uncached Exchange folders

metadata.title: Do not allow passwords to be saved
metadata.description: Do not allow passwords to be saved

metadata.title: Do not allow drive redirection
metadata.description: Do not allow drive redirection

metadata.title: Always prompt client for password upon connection
metadata.description: Always prompt client for password upon connection

metadata.title: Set client connection encryption level
metadata.description: Set client connection encryption level

metadata.title: Set a time limit for disconnected sessions
metadata.description: You can use this policy setting to specify the maximum amount of time that a disconnected session is kept active on the server. By default, Terminal Services allows users to disconnect from a remote session without logging off and ending the session. (1 min)

criterion.comment: Registry key HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services!MaxDisconnectionTime exists
Registry key HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services!MaxDisconnectionTime = var

metadata.title: Set a time limit for active but idle Terminal Services sessions
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to specify the maximum amount of time that an active Terminal Services session can be idle (without user input) before it is automatically disconnected. (15 min)

criterion.comment: Registry key HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services!MaxIdleTime exists
Registry key HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services!MaxIdleTime = var

metadata.title: Configure Microsoft SpyNet Reporting
metadata.description: When Windows Defender detects software or changes by software not yet classified for risks, you see how other members responded to the alert. In turn, the action you apply help other members choose how to respond. Your actions also help Microsoft choose which software to investigate for potential threats. You can choose to send basic or additional information about detected software. Additional information helps improve how Windows Defender works. It can include, for example, the location of detected items on your computer if harmful software has been removed. Windows Defender will automatically collect and send the information.

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\SpyNet does not exist

metadata.title: Disable Logging
metadata.description: If this setting is enabled Windows Error Reporting events will not be logged to the system event log.

metadata.title: Disable Windows Error Reporting
metadata.description: If this setting is enabled, Windows Error Reporting will not send any problem information to Microsoft. Additionally, solution information will not be available in the Problem Reports and Solutions control panel.

metadata.title: Display Error Notification
metadata.description: Display Error Notification

metadata.title: Do Not Send Additional Data
metadata.description: If this setting is enabled any additional data requests from Microsoft in response to a Windows Error Reporting event will be automatically declined without notice to the user.

metadata.title: Turn off Heap termination on corruption
metadata.description: Turn off Heap termination on corruption

metadata.title: Turn off shell protocol protected mode
metadata.description: Turn off shell protocol protected mode

metadata.title: Disable IE security prompt for Windows Installer scripts
metadata.description: Disable IE security prompt for Windows Installer scripts

metadata.title: Enable user control over installs
metadata.description: Permits users to change installation options that typically are available only to system administrators. This setting bypasses some of the security features of Windows Installer.

metadata.title: Prohibit non-administrators from applying vendor signed updates
metadata.description: This setting controls the ability of non-administrators to install updates that have been digitally signed by the application vendor.

metadata.title: Prohibit non-administrators from applying vendor signed updates
metadata.description: This setting controls the ability of non-administrators to install updates that have been digitally signed by the application vendor.

metadata.title: Turn off the communitication features
metadata.description: Windows Mail will not check your newsgroup servers for Communities support.

metadata.title: Turn off Windows Mail application
metadata.description: Denies or allows access to the Windows Mail application. If you enable this setting, access to the Windows Mail application is denied. If you disable or do not configure this setting, access to the Windows Mail application is allowed.

metadata.title: Prevent Windows Media DRM Internet Access
metadata.description: Prevents Windows Media Digital Rights Management (DRM) from accessing the Internet (or intranet). When enabled, Windows Media DRM is prevented from accessing the Internet (or intranet) for license acquisition and security upgrades.

metadata.title: Do Not Show First Use Dialog Boxes
metadata.description: Do Not Show First Use Dialog Boxes This policy prevents the Privacy Options and Installation Options dialog boxes from being displayed the first time a user starts Windows Media Player. This policy prevents the dialog boxes which allow users to select privacy, file types, and other desktop options from being displayed when the Player is first started. Some of the options can be configured by using other Windows Media Player group policies. When this policy is not configured or disabled, the dialog boxes are displayed when the user starts the Player for the first time.

metadata.title: Prevent Automatic Updates
metadata.description: Prevents users from being prompted to update Windows Media Player. This policy prevents the Player from being updated and prevents users with administrator rights from being prompted to update the Player if an updated version is available. The Check for Player Updates command on the Help menu in the Player is not available. In addition, none of the time intervals in the Check for updates section on the Player tab are selected or available. When this policy is not configured or disabled, Check for Player Updates is available only to users with administrator rights and they may be prompted to update the Player if an updated version is available. By default, users with administrator rights can select how frequently updates are checked for. Users without administrator rights do not see Check for Player Updates and are never prompted to update the Player even without this policy.

metadata.title: Turn off Windows Meeting Space
metadata.description: Windows Meeting Space is a feature that enables quick, face-to-face collaboration for sharing programs and handouts and for passing notes. If you enable this setting, Windows Meeting Space will be turned off.

metadata.title: Do not allow Windows Messenger to be run
metadata.description: Do not allow Windows Messenger to be run

metadata.title: Do not automatically start Windows Messenger initially

metadata.title: Disable unpacking and installation of gadgets that are not digitally sugned
metadata.description: Sidebar gadgets can be deployed as compressed files, either digitally signed or unsigned. If you enable this setting, Windows Sidebar will not extract any gadgets that have not been digitally signed. If you disable or do not configure this setting, Window

metadata.title: Microsoft Windows Vista is installed
metadata.description: The operating system installed on the system is Microsoft Windows Vista

modified.comment: Vista test updated because of the conflictions with Server 2008

criterion.comment: the installed operating system is part of the Microsoft Windows family

family_test.comment: the installed operating system is part of the Microsoft Windows family

Does not audit attempts to create, change, or delete a user account or attempts to rename, disable, enable, or change a password of a user account.
Audits the successful attempts to create, change, or delete a user account or attempts to rename, disable, enable, or change a password of a user account.
Audits failed attempts to create, change, or delete a user account or attempts to rename, disable, enable, or change a password of a user account.
Audits the successful and failed attempts to create, change, or delete a user account or attempts to rename, disable, enable, or change a password of a user account.
Does not audit attempts to access directory services.
Audits the successful attempts to access directory services.
Audits failed attempts to access directory services.
Audits the successful and failed attempts to access directory services.
Does not audit attempts of users logging on, logging off, or making a network connection to the local computer.
Audits the successful attempts of users logging on, logging off, or making a network connection to the local computer.
Audits failed attempts of users logging on, logging off, or making a network connection to the local computer.
Audits the successful and failed attempts of users logging on, logging off, or making a network connection to the local computer.
Does not audit attempts of a user accessing an object that has its own SACL specified.
Audits the successful attempts of a user accessing an object that has its own SACL specified.
Audits failed attempts of a user accessing an object that has its own SACL specified.
Audits the successful and failed attempts of a user accessing an object that has its own SACL specified.
Does not audit attempt to change user rights assignment policies, audit policies, and trust policies.
Audits the successful attempt to change user rights assignment policies, audit policies, and trust policies.
Audits failed attempt to change user rights assignment policies, audit policies, and trust policies.
Audits the successful and failed attempt to change user rights assignment policies, audit policies, and trust policies.
Does not audit attempts by a user in exercising a user right.
Audits the successful attempts by a user in exercising a user right.
Audits failed attempts by a user in exercising a user right.
Audits the successful and failed attempts by a user in exercising a user right.
Does not audit events such as program activation, process exit, handle duplication, and indirect object access.
Audits the successful events such as program activation, process exit, handle duplication, and indirect object access.
Audits failed events such as program activation, process exit, handle duplication, and indirect object access.
Audits the successful and failed events such as program activation, process exit, handle duplication, and indirect object access.
Does not audit attempts of a user restarting or shutting down the computer or when an event occurs that affects either the system security or the security log.
Audits the successful attempts of a user restarting or shutting down the computer or when an event occurs that affects either the system security or the security log.
Audits failed attempts of a user restarting or shutting down the computer or when an event occurs that affects either the system security or the security log.
Audits the successful and failed attempts of a user restarting or shutting down the computer or when an event occurs that affects either the system security or the security log.

external_variable.comment: maximum size (in bytes) of application log
maximum size (in bytes) of security log
maximum size (in bytes) of setup log
maximum size (in bytes) of system log

Internet Explorer Maintenance Policy Processing - NoBackgroundPolicy
